author: swebb
title: Father’s chilling text to ex-lover after throwing their seven-month-old baby off a bridge before jumping off in failed suicide bid – as he’s convicted of murder
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A FATHER who threw his seven-month-old baby from a bridge before leaping himself sent a chilling text to his ex-partner saying: “He’s dead. Soon I will be too.” 
Tony Moreno, 23, of Middletown, Connecticut, was convicted of murder yesterday for throwing his 7-month-old son Aaden off a 90-foot-high bridge to his death. AP:Associated Press Tony Moreno demonstrates to the jury how he held his son Aaden on the railing of the Arrigoni Bridge AP:Associated Press Text messaging records showing exchanges between Tony Moreno and Adrianne Oyola in the final moments of their son’s life 
He faces up to 70 years in prison when he’s sentenced in May. 
Moreno threw the child off the Arrigoni Bridge that spans the Connecticut River between Middletown and Portland on July 15, 2015, and then jumped intending to kill himself, prosecutors said. 
Moreno spent several days in the hospital. Aaden’s body was found by a kayaker 14 miles downstream two days later. Related stories Couple at centre of 'murder-suicide stabbing in Cheshunt witnessed by their horrified children' named DOUBLE TRAGEDY Man, 70, 'murdered his wife at marital home before killing himself by driving into tree' in suspected murder-suicide in rural Somerset village 'VOW BREAKER' Former chaplain shoots dead his daughter, 27, then spray-paints revenge note to wife in murder-suicide The invisible Women Man who hacked his family to death in a murder-suicide was painted as the victim... and he's not alone IT'S A MIRACLE Two boys aged one and three, SURVIVE when father makes murder-suicide bid jumping off 100 ft high bridge 
Moreno testified in his own defence, claiming the baby slipped from his arms and he never intended to harm him. 
He was pictured in court cradling a toy doll to demonstrate how he held his son on the bridge’s railing. 
Defence lawyer Norman Pattis raised the possibility that Aaden may have had a muscle disorder that caused sudden, jerking motions to explain why Moreno dropped him. 
Moreno had a strained relationship with the boy’s mother, prosecutors said. AP:Associated Press Moreno faces 70 years in prison AP:Associated Press 6 Mum Adrianne Oyola testifies during Tony Moreno’s murder trial 
The mother, 20-year-old Adrianne Oyola, testified that things got worse when she refused his marriage proposal a month before the baby’s death. The two shared custody of Aaden. 
A police officer and a hospital psychiatrist testified that Moreno made statements indicating that he had killed the child. 
Prosecutors also introduced text messages between Moreno and Oyola as evidence, including one where in response to a question about Aaden’s whereabouts, Moreno wrote: “He’s dead. Soon I will be too.” 
She replied: “You couldn’t kill your own son!” and: “Please don’t hurt Aaden!!!” AP:Associated Press Defence lawyer Norman Pattis told the court the killing was not intentional AP:Associated Press 6 Denise Moreno, the mother of Tony Moreno, described the day her grandson died 
Middletown police officer Austin Smith went to the Arrigoni Bridge after Tony Moreno’s mother alerted police that he was distressed. 
Jurors heard a 911 call in which Denise Moreno told dispatchers her son said he was going to jump from the bridge and that he was with his son. 
Smith said he arrived at the scene around the same time as Moreno’s mother and brother. 
Smith testified that he shouted “Tony, stop!” before Moreno climbed over a railing and jumped to the river 90 feet below. 
He said there was an empty stroller but the infant could not be found, despite searches for the boy. 
Defence attorney Norman Pattis said the verdict was disappointing.
